title: "We're nerfing Poppy's positioning ability and defensive values because she's too stat checky"
body:
Meanwhile

"Dr. Mundo
    Sadism (R) max health regen increased from 40/50/60% to 50/75/100%"


"Garen
    Decisive Strike (Q) bonus damage increased from 30/55/80/105/130 to 30/65/100/135/170

    Courage (W) 
        tenacity increased from 60% to 85%
        damage reduction increased from 60% to 85%"


In the same fucking patch cycle.

replies.body: Is poppy dominating play right now?
She is dominating "how to be useless all game" division.

{{champion:78}} with 47.50% win rate getting nerfed a couple patches after they specifically introduced a keystone that increased her counters and made a lot of her matchups significantly harder.

It is a terrible balance decision that SHOULD be heavily criticized. It hurts Jungle Poppy, Support Poppy, and Top Poppy for no clear objective reason (at this time). If she were to become oppressive, then I'd change my tune. 

I like to play her, so competing with others to play her and having her banned consistently for being OP does not interest me long-term.

But does it hurt mid poppy? 

- Riot Games

Mid poppy is actually a lot of fun against AD assassins. Take demolish. Build sunfire cape. 

Ask the assassin in /all where his tower went. 

He'll respond by asking you where your bot lane is, and you'll both be having the best time of your life.

{{champion:36}}  gets that specific buff due to the changes to AP itemization with {{item:3165}}  being an auto-include to mid laners.

There's also {{item:3123}}  which is a cheaper version for ADCs/assassins.

But meanwhile, in the same patch, Warwick q, from which he heals, get nerfed at max rank. 

While they should nerf his early w or maybe e, overall nerf his early and buff his late... as q is already weak late because of grevious wound anyway.

Warwick isn't almost entirely defined by his ability to heal off Q.

Mundo's ability to healtank with is ult is basically... well... all of Mundo. He doesn't really bring a whole lot.

Warwick has extremely high-speed roaming, innate tankiness, 2 *very* hard CCs, and healing. Losing a bit off of one of those doesn't hurt his core identity and value that much. 

Mundo *needs* his ult to be strong because he doesn't really have much else. Warwick has other options, and is somewhat strong (albeit not nerf-worthy imo).

Mundo only got an ability that grants him massive amounts of free AD, free %magic resist and....er...give me a year and a rework and I can tell you more strengths. Nearly infinite no-mana-cost poke? Its just an outdated champion with strong parts to his E. Outside of that his only strength is to force enemies to buy {{item:3076}} , {{item:3123}} or {{item:3165}}

And again, he still adds almost nothing except raw tanky stats.

He has almost zero playmaking potential, he can't pick, he can't peel, he honestly cannot do a whole lot.

EXCEPT (*gasp*)

That thing I said. Where he hits his ult and walks into the enemy team borderline-unkillable.

Warwick is a vastly superior champion in the hands of someone skilled because of his options. He can *do* things. He brings things to the team besides raw defensive stats and a shitty slow.

They aren't remotely comparable, which is why Mundo *needs* his ultimate, but Warwick doesn't *need* his Q to have crazy heal power on it.

If you can'y understand this concept I honestly can't help you, this is basically champion design 101.

I did not even mention Warwick in my comment. I only said that Mundo E is the only somewhat up do date ability in his kit (since it kinda did get reworked last season) and that he forced them to buy Grievous Wounds so he is not _borderline unkillable_
I think a lot of people max Q first so he's getting this nerf for his mid game moreso than his late game.

Honestly they could have simply removed the health cost from his ultimate and called it a day... No offense to Mundo players but his gameplay is eye-gougingly boring to play against and lacks a fundamental amount of counterplay. Mundo is basically the poster-child of stat-checky champions and until that's fixed in an eventual VGU he shouldn't be buffed. The planned ultimate changes will basically give Mundo the full value of his current ultimate when people are applying greivous wounds on him. That's _insane_.

I'm not saying both are OP or that Poppy is UP, but come on.

1. Her one knock up is her W, which you have to dash/jump inside or against to even trigger the knock up, which isn't even that long.

2. Her other knock up is on her ultimate, which if you instant-cast it without charging, has a knock up that is even weaker in duration than {{champion:12}} Q and the cooldown is 10 times longer. The AOE around it is even smaller.


Also no gap closers on them? Garen's Q makes him run 30% faster for up to 3.5 seconds, and it can remove some slows on him. It also has a low cooldown of 8 seconds (after you swing with it). This is three times a lower cooldown than Poppy's movement speed buff which doesn't even start off at max speed.
Mundo's ult obviously has a munch longer cooldown, but he still moves a lot faster with it. Not to mention he can literally perma slow you with cleavers which slow you by a whopping 40% movement speed even at level 1.
Let's also not forget that both of these champions have a good chunk of built-in tenacity in their kits, whilst Poppy has none, giving them a much easier time for them to stick on whoever they're targeting.

And Garen literally has a point and click *true damage* ultimate which does more damage based on the opponent's *missing health* -- so you can't even build against aside from not having the most kills in the match. If that's not "stat checking" then I don't even know what is.

Also, Garen and Mundo have no mana to manage. Poppy does. And her stun can be counter played by not standing near a wall. That's not exactly difficult, leaving her only real source of reliable hard CC being her ultimate.

There are some really important differences between Mundo/Garen and Poppy.

Mundo and Garen are juggernauts. They have very low CC and no team utility. If you they aren't doing a lot of damage and sponging up a lot of damage, they are completely useless. They are, quintessentially, stat checks.

Poppy has a ton of team utility. She has a small knockback that can stun, she cancels dashes in a large zone around her, and she has her massive ultimate knockback.

Poppy doesn't need to be as amazing a fighter in order to be useful. She brings stuff to the table aside from raw damage and tankiness.

Garen and Mundo need to be tanky as hell and do a lot of damage in order to ever be picked, because they bring absolutely nothing else to the table.

I do think Garen and Mundo can stand to have kit tweaks at some point. They are very binary and stat-checky. But in the meantime, they are just straight up underpowered, and could use some love.
